texts.value: Transaminase with broad substrate specificity. Has transaminase activity towards aminoadipate, kynurenine, methionine and glutamate. Shows activity also towards tryptophan, aspartate and hydroxykynurenine. Accepts a variety of oxo-acids as amino-group acceptors, with a preference for 2-oxoglutarate, 2-oxocaproic acid, phenylpyruvate and alpha-oxo-gamma-methiol butyric acid. Can also use glyoxylate as amino-group acceptor (in vitro)
Amino-acid degradation; L-lysine degradation via saccharopine pathway; glutaryl-CoA from L-lysine: step 4/6
Belongs to the class-I pyridoxal-phosphate-dependent aminotransferase family

citation.title: Cloning and functional expression of a soluble form of kynurenine/alpha-aminoadipate aminotransferase from rat kidney.
The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).
Quantitative maps of protein phosphorylation sites across 14 different rat organs and tissues.

referencePositions: IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS]

properties.value: Expressed in kidney and 16 other cell types or tissues
P:L-lysine catabolic process to acetyl-CoA via saccharopine
Type I PLP-dependent aspartate aminotransferase-like (Major domain)
